column4: would this be where i could get some help with java? its been rather evil lately.
is it installing Java in Ubuntu?
how did you install Java?
whatpackage did you install?
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc    please
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/java; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install oracle-java7-installer
That is Oracle Java latest, try now
that's all I know, the /usr/bin/java will now point to the oracle java. Did you try a reboot?
try running the app from terminal, it ma give clues
what file are you trying to run with java?
where is the file located? The path is VERY case sensitive
then run:    java ~/Downloads/minecraft.jar
ok, you now have a lead, use the wb to see what that means
think about it
the DIROFJAR is ~/Downloads    again....think about it.....
what is the output of:  uname -m
try:    java -Xmx1024M -Xms512M -cp ~/Downloads/minecraft.jar net.minecraft.LauncherFrame
guess how we are finding al this stuff?
does MiningMarsh's command work?
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle/jre/lib/i386/"; java -jar ~/Downloads/minecraft.jar
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle/jre/lib/i386"; java -jar ~/Downloads/minecraft.jar
run the second one
to be 100% sure you could reinstall
